p: Members of Zingiberaceae are known for containing terpenoids, flavonoids, phenypropanoids and sesquiterpenes, which have antitumor activities [ 110, 162]. Some Curcuma essential oils have remarkable antioxidant and antimicrobial activities that make them ideal candidates for use in pharmaceutical and cosmetic industries. The variations in chemical composition imply the possibility of different biological activities of the same plant species from different locations. A summary of the biological activities of different Curcuma essential oils is presented in Table 2.
